course_constraints.title: Arrangements for 3584 Commerce / Information Systems Students
course_constraints.description: Students may choose INFSG2 as their minor for the Bachelor of Commerce component. However, all overlapping courses cannot be applied to both INFSG2 and the Bachelor of Information Systems (BIS) program. INFS1701 and INFS2701 must be counted towards INFSG2, and students must complete two additional level 2/3 Prescribed Information Systems Electives to replace INFS1701 and INFS2701 in the BIS program.

course_constraints.title: Arrangements for 3784 Commerce / Computer Science Students
course_constraints.description: For students enrolled in the double-degree program Bachelor of Commerce/Bachelor of Science (Computer Science, non-Security Engineering major),  COMP6441/COMP6841 is counted as a Business school course. For students enrolled in the double degree program Bachelor of Commerce/Bachelor of Science (Computer Science- Security Engineering major), COMP6441/COMP6841 must be counted towards the Computer Science - Security Engineering major. Students must  instead complete either INFS3922 or INFS3959 to fulfil the 30 UOC INFSG2 minor requirement.

courses.INFS2701: Managing Cybersecurity in the Digital Age

course_constraints.title: Arrangements for 3784 Commerce / Computer Science Students
course_constraints.description: For students enrolled in the double-degree program Bachelor of Commerce/Bachelor of Science (Computer Science, non-Security Engineering major),  COMP6441/COMP6841 is counted as a Business school course. Additionally, students must choose three INFSG1 Prescribed Electives offered by the Business School to fulfil the 96 UOC Business School disciplinary requirement. Students cannot count COMP electives towards INFSG1 requirements. For students enrolled in the double degree program Bachelor of Commerce/Bachelor of Science (Computer Science- Security Engineering major), COMP6441/COMP6841 and completed COMPXXXX courses from the INFSG1 Prescribed Electives list must be counted towards the Computer Science - Security Engineering major. Therefore, students must complete additional INFSG1 electives offered by the Business School to fulfil the 48 UOC major requirement and 96 UOC Business School disciplinary requirement.

course_constraints.title: Arrangements for 3584 Commerce / Information Systems Students
course_constraints.description: Students may choose INFSG1 as their major for the Bachelor of Commerce component. However, all overlapping courses cannot be applied to both INFSG1 and the Bachelor of Information Systems (BIS) program. INFS1701 and INFS2701 must be counted towards INFSG1, and students must complete two additional level 2/3 Prescribed Information Systems Electives to replace INFS1701 and INFS2701 in the BIS program. INFS2822 and INFS3701 must be counted towards BIS requirements and so cannot be chosen as INFSG1 electives. Students must complete three other courses (2 of which must be INFS3XXX courses) from the INFSG1 Prescribed Electives list.

curriculum.title: Prescribed Elective Courses
curriculum.notes: A minimum of two (2) elective courses must be level 3 INFS courses (i.e., INFS3XXX). This criterion applies regardless of whether students are pursuing a single major or choosing Cybersecurity Management as the second major. course_constraints.title: Cross-Institutional Prescribed Electives
course_constraints.description: Students in the intermediate and advanced sequences who will complete some components of their sequence via cross-institutional study are advised that they are responsible for enrolling themselves before the appropriate UNSW and partner university deadlines for cross-institutional enrolment, which fall well before the beginning of regular UNSW teaching periods. See: https://www.student.unsw.edu.au/cross-institutional-study. Each course of cross-institutional study requires approval from the German Studies convenor, with whom students must consult at an early stage to discuss the selection of courses. Students who successfully complete German Studies courses cross-institutionally will have their results reported as transfer credits at UNSW, i.e. specific grades will not appear on their transcript. If in a given term you are unable to take appropriate courses cross-institutionally you may be eligible to apply for an individual variation of program.

If you have undertaken HSC Extension 1 or 2 mathematics, both MATH1131/1141 (Mathematics 1A or Higher Mathematics 1A) and MATH1231/1241 (Mathematics 1B or Higher Mathematics 1B), are recommended instead of MATH1031 (Mathematics for Life Sciences).

course_constraints.title: Double Major: Mathematics and Physics
course_constraints.description: Students who are contemplating a double major in Mathematics and Physics should complete the following 36UOC of Stage 2 MATH courses: MATH2301 MATH2011/2111 MATH2121/2221 MATH2501/2601 MATH2521/2621 MATH2801/2901 No substitutes are permitted. The requirement for MATH2069 in the Physics major is replaced by the combination of (MATH2011 or MATH2111) and (MATH2521 or MATH2621) in the MATH Major. The requirement for MATH2089 in the Physics major is replaced by MATH2301 and the other level 2 MATH courses in the MATH Major.

course_constraints.title: Course Selection
course_constraints.description: Students are advised to select their courses carefully to ensure prerequisites for Stage 2 and 3 electives are met. It is recommended that Stage 1 students enrol into CHEM1011 unless they are considering a Chemistry major. Chemistry majors should enrol in CHEM1031.

course_constraints.title: Level 1 Recommended Electives
course_constraints.description: The following courses are not required but are recommended as good complementary courses for this major. - PHYS1111 Fundamentals of Physics, PHYS1121 Physics 1A or PHYS1131 Higher Physics 1A - CHEM1041 Higher Chemistry B - VISN1221 Visual Optics Students who intend to take Psychology electives in Stages 2 and 3 should take the following courses: - PSYC1001 Psychology 1A - PSYC1011 Psychology 1B - PSYC1111 Measuring Mind and Behaviour

course_constraints.title: Level 3 Recommended Electives
course_constraints.description: The following courses are not required but are recommended as good complementary courses for this major. - OPTM3105 Disease Processes of the Eye 1 - OPTM3205 Disease Processes of the Eye 2 - OPTM3133 Vision Science in the Consulting Room - NEUR3211 Neuroscience Research Seminars - PSYC3221 Vision and Brain - PSYC3211 Cognitive Science - ANAT3131 Functional Anatomy 1 - SCIF3041 Research Internship B

course_constraints.title: Level 2 Recommended Electives
course_constraints.description: The following courses are not required but are recommended as good complementary courses for this major. - OPTM2133 The Clinical Environment - OPTM2233 Optical Dispensing - PSYC2071 Perception and Cognition - PSYC2001 Research Methods 2 - SCIF2041 Research Internship A - VISN1221 Visual Optics

It is highly recommended that Advanced Science students majoring in Vision Science take SCIF2041 and SCIF3041 in Stages 2 and 3.
